title: Function inlining is a common compiler optimization for improving performance of the code.

inline_content.Text: Function inlining is a common compiler optimization for improving performance of the code.

title: Small, frequently called functions can be directly included (inlined) in the body of the calling function. This eliminate function calling overhead.

inline_content.Text: Small, frequently called functions can be directly included (inlined) in the body of the calling function. This eliminate function calling overhead.

title: Unlike C++, Go compiler doesn't have a way to force inlining of functions.

inline_content.Text: Unlike C++, Go compiler doesn't have a way to force inlining of functions.

title: Go compiler makes inlining decisions based on a number of heuristics.

inline_content.Text: Go compiler makes inlining decisions based on a number of heuristics.

title: Here's an incomplete list of attributes that disable inlining:

inline_content.Text: Here's an incomplete list of attributes that disable inlining:

title: Functions have a “max hairyness” greater than the budget (they recurse too much or can’t be analyzed for some other reason)

inline_content.Text: Functions have a “max hairyness” greater than the budget (they recurse too much or can’t be analyzed for some other reason)

title: Checking if a function was inlined

inline_content.Text: Checking if a function was inlined

title: We can find out which functions were inlined with
-gcflags -m
c
compiler flags. For example:

inline_content.Text: We can find out which functions were inlined with

title:
$ go build -gcflags -m .
# github.com/kjk/notionapi
./dbg.go:15:6: can inline log
./dbg.go:38:5: inlining call to log
./client.go:61:25: inlining call to bytes.NewBuffer
./client.go:62:5: inlining call to lo
...

content_resolved.code:
$ go build -gcflags -m .
# github.com/kjk/notionapi
./dbg.go:15:6: can inline log
./dbg.go:38:5: inlining call to log
./client.go:61:25: inlining call to bytes.NewBuffer
./client.go:62:5: inlining call to lo
...

title: Go only inlines very small functions. Some functions that are too big to be inlined can be split into 2 functions:

inline_content.Text: Go only inlines very small functions. Some functions that are too big to be inlined can be split into 2 functions:

title: Here's an example from Go standard library. A function
sync.Do()
c

title: This optimization only makes a difference if a function is called a lot and most of the time the slow path is not called.

inline_content.Text: This optimization only makes a difference if a function is called a lot and most of the time the slow path is not called.

title: Inline expansion can be disabled with the
go:noinline
c
pragma. For example, if we build the following simple program:

title: we get output that looks like this (trimmed for readability):

inline_content.Text: we get output that looks like this (trimmed for readability):

title:
$ go version
go version go1.6.2 linux/amd64
$ go build main.go
$ ./main
Hello
$ go tool objdump main
TEXT main.main(SB) /home/sam/main.go
        main.go:7       0x401000        64488b0c25f8ffffff      FS MOVQ FS:0xfffffff8, CX
        main.go:7       0x401009        483b6110                CMPQ 0x10(CX), SP
        main.go:7       0x40100d        7631                    JBE 0x401040
        main.go:7       0x40100f        4883ec10                SUBQ $0x10, SP
        main.go:8       0x401013        e8281f0200              CALL runtime.printlock(SB)
        main.go:8       0x401018        488d1d01130700          LEAQ 0x71301(IP), BX
        main.go:8       0x40101f        48891c24                MOVQ BX, 0(SP)
        main.go:8       0x401023        48c744240805000000      MOVQ $0x5, 0x8(SP)
        main.go:8       0x40102c        e81f290200              CALL runtime.printstring(SB)
        main.go:8       0x401031        e89a210200              CALL runtime.printnl(SB)
        main.go:8       0x401036        e8851f0200              CALL runtime.printunlock(SB)
        main.go:9       0x40103b        4883c410                ADDQ $0x10, SP
        main.go:9       0x40103f        c3                      RET
        main.go:7       0x401040        e87b9f0400              CALL runtime.morestack_noctxt(SB)
        main.go:7       0x401045        ebb9                    JMP main.main(SB)
        main.go:7       0x401047        cc                      INT $0x3
